extendedInfo.description: More than 1 million active members, including 50% of U.S. physicians, rely on Epocrates to enable better patient care by delivering the right information, right when it's needed. Healthcare professionals worldwide use Epocrates routinely to:-Review drug prescribing and safety information for thousands of brand, generic, and OTC drugs-Check for potentially harmful drug-drug interactions among up to 30 drugs at a time-Select national and regional healthcare insurance formularies for drug coverage information-Identify pills by imprint code and physical characteristics-Perform dozens of calculations, such as BMI and GFR-Access timely medical news and research informationDisease information, alternative medications, lab guides and more clinical tools and content are available by upgrading to an Epocrates Essentials subscription.

reviews.title: Not stable
reviews.comment: With the recent upgrade the program locks quite a bit.  I find myself having to restart it multiple times. I\'ve also had to force close it.  It doesn\'t seem to work on my android phone any longer.  Prior to the last 3 upgrades it worked wonderfully.   This app has become a \'must\' for any practioner who needs/wants a quick reference in a busy clinic.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great quick reference
reviews.comment: Samsung Galaxy S III Easy to use and gives the amount of information needed.
reviews.author: Marygrace Gonzalez

reviews.title: Locks up
reviews.comment: With the recent update, every time I click on the big E button in the Bottom right hand corner to search for a new medication after I am already looking at one, it freezes so that I have to stop the program all together and restart it in order for it to work.
reviews.author: Peter Roumanos

reviews.title: Useful when not bugging.
reviews.comment: Great info.  Tends to freeze on me often, requiring a force stop and restart.  I\'m glad this is only a student trial.  Had I paid money for the subscription, I\'d have asked for a refund.
reviews.author: Scott Barnes

reviews.title: Not so good now
reviews.comment: Has become unreliable and frequently locks up requiring sometimes not only closing program and clearing cache but even complete restart of the phone. This is unacceptable and greatly compromises program\'s convenience.
reviews.author: Jonathan Russ

reviews.title: Fix the freezing
reviews.comment: Last update rendered this nearly unusable. Freezes whenever I use the \"e\" to return to the home screen, instead have to continually hit the \"back\" button to avoid having to restart my phone to get the app to work again. Use this daily and am very disjointed with this bug, otherwise I am happy with the content. I pay to use the full version. FIX IT.
reviews.author: Crystal Pa

reviews.title: Slow start up on RAZR MAXX HD
reviews.comment: On RAZR MAXX HD it takes 3-7 second to start the app every single time. Thus its too show for a paid app (I purchased the 2 years subscription). Please fix. Otherwise, the app is very useful. However there are at least two other free apps that offer at least as much as Epocrates if not more. Not sure if I will renew mainly because the app is so slow
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not the same as IOS
reviews.comment: New to Android, was glad to have Epocrates back on my new GS4.  Unfortunately, while it is useful for a one time look up, I find that it often freezes up if I want to look up information on another drug in the same session. Very frustrating to have to zap the app closed and more often restart my phone.  I never had this experience with it on the other platform.  Hopefully can be fixed. For now will only rate a 2 star.
reviews.author: William Weeks

reviews.title: Update SUCKS
reviews.comment: Went to update on my S4 & get can\'t install on usb or sd card.  I uninstalled the app,  redownloaded the app & get the same ERROR. No I have no Epocrates App. Please fix it. ....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good when it works
reviews.comment: App is broken and unstable...freezes when loading and when hitting the E button to go back to main screen
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Frustrated physician
reviews.comment: Loved the program but It\'s missing many rheumatology related medications.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Was good
reviews.comment: Hitting the e button has been causing the app to freeze causing me to have to go to settings and manually force close. Please fix. Was an awesome app before.
reviews.author: Chris Lundberg

reviews.title: Package file is invalid
reviews.comment: On the Galaxy S4 on ATT, I get a \"Package file is invalid\" error.
reviews.author: Mark Kittisopikul

reviews.title: Won\'t even open
reviews.comment: What a disappointment!!! :(
reviews.author: Desaree Williams

reviews.title: RX Drug List
reviews.comment: Is there an App like this that will keep your RX list ?
reviews.author: David Nager

reviews.title: Helpful
reviews.comment: Great app!!
reviews.author: Whitney Mccullough

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: Great app.
reviews.author: Tarah Battaglia

reviews.title: Freezes
reviews.comment: Was Very good until updates. Now frequently freezes on Droid RAZR
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: NICE interface. EPOC essentials dlx is my go to source. GREAT product.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great medical app
reviews.comment: I use this frequently for drug  facts. Good medical references.
reviews.author: Bill Moore
